column4: hi everyone, got a question, how can I uninstall X completely?
yes.
just uninstall all the X related packages.
is there like a main core x process tho?
perhaps I sort of remember the whining :-)
are your sort of more familiar with 'aptitude'>
are your sort of more familiar with 'aptitude'?
or 'synaptic'?
there are two/three reasons fro using 'aptitude' or s'synaptic; here..
they do the cache thing too a lot better.
package lists, by topic, e.g. X, and lists of just installed packages, and the ability to see fboth forward and reverse dependencies.
so you can get the ''umbrella'' X virtual package, see all its dependendencies, and just uninstall all those.
tried aptitude, wouldnt let me remove it tho ?
how can I first terminate X, tried killing its process , just boots again
switch runlevel to runelvel 2
or stop 'gdm' as zenrox says, but I suspect runlevel 2 is mote right.
its the same for AMD and Intel 64 bit...
if you are asking, it is not an Itanic...
yes, and is the same as AMD64.
it is almost identical, so the same binaries work on botjh, it just requires a tiny few changes in the kernel, and they both there.
